summary: Charles Robert Richet  was a French physiologist.
full_text:
Charles Robert Richet  was a French physiologist who initially investigated a variety of subjects such as neurochemistry, digestion, thermoregulation in homeothermic animals, and breathing. He won the Nobel Prize "in recognition of his work on anaphylaxis" in 1913. He also presided the French Eugenic Society from 1920 to 1926.
He also devoted many years to the study of spiritualist phenomena.
title: Charles Robert Richet
